visual_events.description: The video starts with a first-person view of a mountain biker holding handlebars, facing a dirt path with mountains and a clear sky in the background. Other bikers are visible further down the path.
The rider starts pedaling forward on a wide dirt path, passing a wooden sign for 'Skills Park'.
The rider enters a wooded section, and the dirt path narrows, becoming more uneven with small rocks and roots.
The rider navigates a banked turn (berm) within the forest.
The rider transitions onto a short wooden structure, moving into a more open area with visible jumps and rollers.
The rider goes around a large, sweeping dirt berm.
The rider approaches a sign indicating a split in the trail, offering 'Upper B-Line' and 'Jump Trail B-Line'.
The rider enters the 'Upper B-Line' trail, which is a narrower, more technical singletrack winding through dense trees.
The rider splashes through a small muddy puddle and the trail widens significantly, opening up to an area with ski lifts visible in the distance.
The rider passes a trail entrance sign and re-enters a wooded section with smooth, flowing dirt trails.
The rider transitions onto a long, wooden boardwalk section, winding through the forest.
The rider rides over a large, flat rock feature on the trail.
The rider passes a 'Yield' sign, indicating an intersection with another trail.
The rider rides off a wooden feature (possibly a jump or drop) and into an open, sunny area.
The rider enters another wooded, technical section with many roots and rocks.
The rider enters another long, winding wooden boardwalk section within the forest.
The rider exits the dense woods onto a wide, open dirt path with clear views of the distant mountains and ski slopes.
The rider passes a 'Warning Slow' sign and wooden barriers, indicating approach to the base area.
The rider rides onto an open, slightly downhill section with jumps and rollers in the distance, heading towards the main base area.
The rider passes a sign for 'Naughty Hands' trail, entering a singletrack with roots and tight turns.
The rider enters and rides through a short, dark tunnel under a bridge.
The rider approaches the base village area, with buildings, people, and other bikers clearly visible.
The rider slows down, navigating through metal barriers and 'Slow' signs at the base of the bike park.
The rider enters the crowded village square, passing 'Please Walk Bikes' signs, and begins walking the bike through the pedestrian area.
The video ends with the rider continuing to walk the bike through the bustling village square on a sunny day.
